Description.div: The OrderHeaderKey, or the EnterpriseCode, DocumentType and the OrderNo must be passed to identify the Order.

Element.Description: If the order doesn't exist in the system, then order line information must be provided to the API.

Description.div: Optional. Stores order line information, including item details and shipping information. Multiple OrderLines can be created for a single order. At least one OrderLine must exist for an order if order is getting created with DraftOrderFlag as 'N'. For draft order, line must be added before confirming the order.
The BOM XML to be used to create the order line and its components.

Describes how product is delivered. DeliveryMethod is only valid for product lines.
Valid Values: DEL - Delivery, SHP -Ship, CARRY - Cash And Carry or PICK - Pickup by the user.
If a DeliveryMethod value is not passed, the value is set as follows:
If the ProductLine has Delivery associations, set to DEL .
If the Item's DefaultDeliveryMethod has a value of Y
in the catalog, then the Item is checked for shipping methods, as defined by the following fields in the Catalog:
Condition
DeliveryMethod value
IS_SHIPPING_ALLLOWED is Y
SHP
IS_DELIVERY_ALLLOWED is Y
DEL
IS_PICKUP_ALLLOWED is Y
PICK
If a value is passed, it must be a valid value.
This field can be used for line classification and reporting purposes. If department code is passed at order header but not passed at order line then value at order header is pushed to order line.

Indicates how the OrderLines are dependent on the parent line. The DependencyShippingRule can only be specified for the parent line.
If DependencyShippingRule is specified on the parent line, it is defaulted to the same value on all the dependent lines. If DependencyShippingRule is passed on any of the dependent lines, the value passed is ignored.
Default: " " (Null)
Valid values: 01 - Ship together, 02 - Deliver together
If DependencyShippingRule value is 02 , a MergeNode must be specified. Order release created for these lines have a MergeNode value, so shipments are first made to the MergeNode, where they are consolidated for final shipment.
The DependencyShippingRule can only be specified for a product line (ItemGroupCode value is PROD ). A product line associated with a delivery line cannot be a part of any dependency shipping rule.
If DependencyShippingRule is passed for delivery or provided service line or an associated product line.
If MergeNode is not specified for parent line, and DependencyShippingRule value is 02 .
Invalid value is passed.
Based on the DependencyShippingRule, some of attributes on dependent lines are defaulted from the parent line. For these attributes have any value other than what parent line has, the value is ignored. In addition to following attributes EarliestShipDate and EarliestDeliveryDate are also copied from parent line to dependent line.
Value
ShippingRule
ShipNode
ReceivingNode
ShipTo
MergeNode
ReqShipDate
ReqDeliveryDate
01 defaults defaults - - - defaults defaults
02 defaults - defaults defaults defaults defaults defaults

If passed then supplies and demands are read applying the distribution rule filter for inventory availability.
Must be a valid DistributionRuleID for the seller organization passed.

The minimum quantity of the OrderedQty that must be fulfilled in a single release.
Default: 0
Any positive number not greater than line ordered quantity.
If invalid number is passed

This flag indicates whether the order line should be backordered upon creation. If passed as 'Y', the line will be backordered even if inventory is available. If a reservation ID is passed on the order line and reservation exists for a current, past or future date, reservation will be consumed to block inventory for the backordered demand. In this scenario, demand created by the reservation ID is removed, and a backordered demand will be generated. No attempt is made to look for inventory if reservation is not available for the passed reservation ID. For draft orders, the reservation is consumed and the order line is created in created status. During confirmDraftOrder, this line goes in backordered status. This flag is ignored if reservation is mandatory. This flag should not be passed for bundle parent lines. If it is passed as 'Y' for bundle parent order line, the line is created in backorder status. It is not propagated to bundle components.

Indicates if the pre-defined node on the line is firm or not. If IsFirmPredefinedNode is marked as N, then the node on the line is ignored during scheduling. If not passed, the default value for this Flag is Y. If ProcureFromNode is passed, this flag will always be set to Y. For a DS or a PS line so, it is defaulted to Y. If the ship node is not present on the line but the value passed is Y, then it is treated as N during scheduling.

Specifies whether the OrderLine is a product, delivery, or provided service Line.
Default: PROD - Product
Valid Values: PROD , DS or PS .
If the ItemGroupCode is not passed, the Item is looked up in the catalog or is assigned during the user exit YCMGetItemDetailsUE. If the Item is not found, the ItemGroupCode is defaulted to PROD .
If the value is passed, it must be a valid value.
When service item which exists in the catalog is passed for bundle parent line.
When DS item is passed as component for a bundle.

Specifies a collection of items that form a unit. For example, a home theater system is a unit, or kit, consisting of components such as a VCR, a TV, a stereo, and other components.
Valid values: LK - Logical kit, PK - Physical kit, DPK - Dynamic Physical kit, BUNDLE - Bundle
If no KitCode is passed, the createOrder API searches the item in the Catalog. The following are the possible scenarios. See Validation Conditions for possible error scenarios.
Kit definition passed
Item in catalog
KitItem
Orderline based on
Y Y Y Passed KitDefinition
N Y Y Catalog definition
Kit definition not passed, item exists in the catalog, it is a kit item, but there is no kit definition.
Kit definition not passed, item does not exist in the catalog.
Kit definition passed as the KitLines element, and the Item is not in catalog.
Kit definition passed as the KitLines element, and the Item is not a KitItem.
Bundle parent line can not have a logical kit component.
Bundle parent line can not have a dynamic physical kit component.

If two or more OrderLines are to be delivered together, this is the node where these lines are merged before final delivery. This field is required when the DependencyShippingRule is set to 02 .
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE.

The preferred minimum ship by date of the available supply that order line can allocate against. Available supply with ship by date earlier than the minimum ship by date will not be considered. This applies to the order line with a valid time-sensitive item. The MinShipByDate of the order line will also be used by all kit lines with valid time-sensitive item.

The quantity of the line item that is being ordered. This quantity is in Inventory UnitOfMeasure. If Quantity needs to be passed in a different UnitOfMeasure (only allowed for a Product line), then it should be passed in OrderLineTranQuantity node.
For a service line item which is used as a standalone service, OrderedQty is treated in the same manner as product lines and must be a non-zero positive number.
The OrderedQty value passed on the service line is ignored, if ordered quantity computaion is not based on entered quantity.
Any non-zero positive number for a product Line or standalone service line.
If SerialNo is provided and OrderedQty is not equal to one.

Pipeline id on order line. If not passed, system will determine the pipeline based on attributes on the line.
It should be a valid pipeline for the process type order line belongs.

The order line number. Part of an OrderLine's unique key. If PrimeLineNo is not passed, it is generated. A starting number can be specified in the configurator at each document type and enterprise level. If a starting number is specified the PrimeLineNo will be generated starting from that number.

The node from which the order line should be procured if cannot source from the shipnode on the order line.
ProcureFromNode can be specified only if shipnode is passed.
If Reservation is attempted from ProcureFromNode, then shipnode must have Procure To Ship Allowed Flag set to Y

The date and time when the appointment ends for an OrderLine.This date only applies to Provided (ItemGroupCode=PS) and Delivered (ItemGroupCode=DS) lines.
PromisedApptEndDate must be greater than or equal to PromisedApptStartDate.
If PromisedApptEndDate is passed, but PromisedApptStartDate is not passed.
If the date corresponds to a slot which cannot be used for appointment planning.

The date and time when the appointment starts for an OrderLine. This date only applies to Provided (ItemGroupCode=PS) and Delivered (ItemGroupCode=DS) lines.
PromisedApptStartDate cannot be after PromisedApptEndDate.
If PromisedApptStartDate is passed, but PromisedApptEndDate is not passed.
If the date corresponds to a slot which cannot be used for appointment planning.

The node to which an OrderLine is to be shipped.
Note: When calling this API for a return order, this ReceivingNode attribute should contain the receiving_node ID associated with the "Ship From" node (the node from which the returned item is shipped).
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE.

This flag indicates whether this line can be created without a reservation. If set to Y, creation of this line or any quantity addition to this line will be allowed only if the quantity can be reserved. If a ProcureFromNode is also present on the line, then the reservation will be carried out on the procure from node. This flag is not supported by bundle parent. It is ignored by bundle parent order lines. It is not propagated to bundle components.

Value of SCAC and Service code.
If ScacAndService or ScacAndServiceKey is passed, the values of SCAC and CarrierServiceCode are overriden based on the corresponding values in the YFS_SCAC_AND_SERVICE table.
Must be an existing ScacAndService code in the table YFS_SCAC_AND_SERVICE.
Indicates Segment for the order line. For a Made To Customer order, the value is defaulted to BuyerOrganizationCode. For a Made To Order Order, the value is defaulted to OrderLineKey.

Indicates SegmentType for the order line. For a Made to Customer Order, the value is MTC. For a Dynamic Physical Kit item which is Made To Order, SegmentType is MTO. For an MTC order, Inventory Tag passed at line level is used. Inventory Tags passed at schedule level are not used for creation of work orders.
If passed as MTC, the following validations are done:
a) Buyer Organization must have Requires_Vas_Compliance flag set to Y
b) Buyer Organization must have have Inbound Vas Compliance setup for the item passed in Order Line.
c) The Service item selected must have Involves_Segment_Change flag set to Y.
If SegmentType is MTC, Buyer Organization must have VAS Compliance setup as specified above.
If passed as MTO, the following validations are done:
a) The KitCode passed must be DPK.
b) The kit components must be passed.
If SegmentType is MTO, the KitCode passed must be DPK
If SegmentType is MTO, the kit components must be passed.

Requested serial number of the item.
If SerialNo is provided and OrderedQty is not equal to one.
If SerialNo is provided but ShipNode is not.

Ship node from which the order line will be fulfilled.
Note: When calling this API for a return order, this ShipNode attribute should contain the shipnode_key associated with the "Return To" node (the node to which the returned item is being sent).
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE
If SerialNo is provided, ShipNode is mandatory
If ShipNode is provided and ReservationID is provided to represent a capacity reservation for the service line and ShipNode is not the same as the node of the resource pool on the reservation.
Times from the database are converted into the timezone specified by this field by the UI. Used with order lines with an ItemGroupCode of PS - Provided Service or DS - Delivery Service.

TransactionalLineId used to identify a line when creating associations of this line with other lines. This TransactionalLineId is not stored in the database and cannot be used after an order has been created. See ProductServiceAssoc entity for more information.
Must be unique for the createOrder transaction.

Indicates if item needs to be validated against catalog. It overrides configuration rule for validating the item if passed non-blank. When set to "N", this order line will not be considered for min/max ordered quantity validation. Must be set to Y to apply entitlement logic.
Default: Null
Valid Values: Y or N

Contains information regarding the item for which order is created. Service items should be defined in the system. If ItemID is not passed, the catalog will be searched for the item which has the same alias as the AlternateItemID. The passed UOM will also be used to search for the item in the catalog. If an item is not found, the AlternateItemID will be used as the ItemID.
If item needs to be validated (based on process type attribute or if ItemGroupCode is PS or DS) then it need to be defined in YFS_ITEM, or be accessible through the getItemDetails user exit.
The Item's country of origin/manufacture. We recommend usage of 2 byte ISO Country Codes.

PaymentMethod can be added, modified or removed .
If payment processing is not required for the order, any payment method passed in the input xml is still subject to validations.
Only the PaymentMethod attributes specified in the input xml can be changed. Attempting to change other attributes on PaymentMethod , such as TotalAuthorized or TotalCharged results in an error.
Pass changed value for attributes not specfied in input xml.

Used to identify the order to which charges are applied.
The Seller Organization can configure the payment types so that they are charged and refunded in a particular sequence. The charge sequence and refund sequence are independent of each other. A PaymentType with a ChargeSequence set to
0
is charged before another PaymentType with ChargeSequence set to
1
.
The Buyer can also specify the ChargeSequence of the PaymentMethod in the createOrder input xml. If a charge sequence is not specified by the Buyer, the Seller's ChargeSequence is followed.
If both the Buyer and the Seller supply ChargeSequence , charges are made in the order that the Seller specifies, but within a particular charge type, such as CreditCard, the Buyer's sequence is honored.
For example:
A seller specifies the ChargeSequence as 0 for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, 1 for CREDIT_CARD, 2 for OTHER.
A buyer specifies the ChargeSequence as 1 for MyBank-CreditCard, 2 for CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, and 3 for MyOther-CreditCard.
The payment methods are charged in the following sequence:
CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT, MyBank-CreditCard, MyOther-CreditCard.
The Customer account is charged because that is the seller's preferred method, and the two credit cards are charged based on the order that the buyer specified.
The Entry Type used to enter payment information into the system.

Type of payment.
The PaymentType must be a value that is already configured for the Seller Organization.
If a PaymentMethod element is passed, the PaymentType is validated, even if payment processing is not required for the order.
Must be a value defined for the Seller Organization.
PaymentType must be passed.

Attribute.Name: Reset
Attribute.Description: Determines whether the OrderSearchConditions should be reset.

Validation.Condition:
Must pass one of the following combinations:
the OrderNo, EnterpriseCode and the DocumentType
or EntityAttributeName or the EntityAttributeValue.
